record.text:
Corrections: Nobuyo Oyama passed on Sept. 29.
She was the third Doraemon voice.
She served the longest in that role, though her successor is getting up there.

On X, I RTed a JP thread about her chiding delinquents for littering.
She feared they'll get defiant, but they apologized, "We can't say no to Doraemon."
These are kids who get stroppy with cops, not just parents and teachers.
But Doraemon is "a friend."
Nobita is every kid in Japan.

She was the second-gen Doraemon VA after Masako Nozawa (Dragon Ball Goku) from 1979 to 2005.
When she met author Fujio F Fujiko, she asked worriedly, "Sensei, Doraemon's voice, is it okay the way I do it?"
FFF: "You made realize that's how Doraemon sounds."

This woman is a shark in IT sales, 33, and cannot be bothered with a boyfriend ("I go on one date and then it gets mendokusai").
Even though she is blood, she remains a mystery to me.

But consider upgrading to a mid-level or better 4KTV even of the same size.
The prices and performance are incredible.
You pay so little for so much nice TV.

Gee, that sounds remarkably similar to my setup.
Pictured is a Sharp Aquos 1080 50, I think.
Not sure of the model year, but probably several years newer than yours.
I still have it and it works, but it's a dumb TV and the reds are definitely bloomy now.
I'll have to huck it when I move.

HDR wasn't really a thing until 2016, so I wasn't in any hurry to replace that FHD TV.
Did go up from 50 to 65 and then to 85.
I'm moving to a smaller place, so any bigger is right out of the question.

And the Sony 65 4KTV (2017 mid-level model) couldn't do 4K with PS4 Pro because it was capped at 60Hz anyway.
It took a Bravia 7 85 to fix that this year.

I hung onto that FHD (1080) 50" TV until at least 2018.
There just wasn't all that much 4K content to really interest me.
The big game changer for me wasn't higher resolution anyway.
It was the eyepopping vividness of HDR and how that affected hockey that moved me.
Good eye. Missed it in front of the Taiko drum pad.

No, no offense taken at all.
I understand what you were saying, and I appreciate it.
Thank you.
I am! Thanks.

The artist, Shawna, is friendly, enthusiastic, informative, and an absolute joy to work with.
Will most definitely get other clothing done.

Yeah, divinity based on merit points reduces it to just another transactional commodity.
Calculations shouldn't be a component of compassion.

It's more than losing someone.
Losing a long beloved spouse is losing a big part of yourself.
It hurts like a sonofabitch but it's a part of the healing, too.

Thank you.
I find more salvation in the random kindness of random, well-meaning strangers than any supposed higher power.

I am on the rebound in a big way.
I've bonded with friends who've lost their spouses.
We've been talking a lot.
We've laughed, cried, raged together.
We get each other.
I'm still fragile af, but in ways that don't frighten me, like not losing my mind.

It's not even eight months for me.
For them, six fucking years.
Fffffuuuuuuck.
When is this going to ever end.

Rather, we both look over our shoulders in vain hope of seeing anything that even reminds us of our partners.
We're still looking for the pieces we lost from ourselves.
Oh, maybe. I don't need that device, though.
ewwwww

Oops.
Not "tweet."
"Post."

Fountain pens also reveal the writing mechanics of the writer. Like, to express it in JP shodo terms, one can see the tome (stop), hane (check), and harai (sweep) tendencies of the writer.
It's a more insightful demonstration of their style.
And a glimpse into their personality.

Also, everyone should experience the joys of writing with fountain pens.
The velvety wetness of the ink, the unmatched smoothness, variability of shading and line weight...it all adds up to a sublime writing experience.
And they're not expensive to get into.
Twenty bucks'll get you started.

Awww, she's a cute Chinese lady.
I found it so adorable, I gave her a delighted grin and a wink.
We say that to each other now.
And she always schedules me for noon at 12.
M dentist's receptionist tells me my appointment is "noon at 12."
Still feels redundant.

I figured that with all the shitposting I do, I could count on some support.
But I was terrified anyway.
Would people consider my writing self-indulgent?
Amateurish?
What if no one liked them?
What would my peers think?
It turns out my peers were the most supportive.
Holy shit.
Oops. Thanks! Fixed it now.

Yeah, there's no way real estate prices are affordable for young people around these parts.
One wonders where the city intends to house infrastructure and services workers.

In loving memory
Takako Ogasawara
"Have a fun!!"

Placed for the family by Port Moody Foundation (or something like that)

"Have a fun!!"
All the neighborhood kids remember her saying that to them when they were goofing around in our yard and garage.

"Have a fun!!"
All the neighborhood kids remember her saying that to them when they were goofing around in our yard and garage.

Thanks.
I had no idea it would be so hard.

It certainly was big.
I think it was one main drag with either two or three intersecting streets crossing it perpendicularly.
Lots of great eats and drinks.
A tad pricey, but so was everything else in that town.
I mean, FIFTEEN BUCKS for a bottle of water at the Bleachers.

In electronics, resistors are marked with colored bands that identify their resistance in ohms.
I think there were nine or ten colors.
There was one guy, real smart, good with his hands, but hopeless at electronics because his colorblindness made it impossible for him to read resistors.

That smoke was apparently some warehouse fire.
But the air quality in LA is revolting.
Couldn't fucking possibly be me.

One each as a primer, then one per inning.
Doable.
But stupid.

There's certainly a Dodgers brand surcharge.
Their cheapest T-shirt was $56.
A jersey set my daughter back close to $270 -- that's way more than a hockey jersey.
And Japanese tourists -- forming a huge portion of the spectators -- bought that stuff up by the armloads.

I'm up the hill on Heritage.
Love the area, but I can get more house if I go out farther east.
Not a big fan of all the traffic down near Rocky Point.

Yeah, it is ridiculous that the dog and I occupy over 4000 sqfeet of living space.
Too many rooms in this house we don't even enter for days.
May as well cash in some of its equity.
I'm thinking a place of up to around $1.2M.
Anyone got neighborhood recommendations locally?

Happy birthday!
Insurance company's sure jumping the gun.

Maybe it works different for the mobile app.
On my web version, the butterfly icon is replaced by a party cracker.

Home page, top center, party cracker icon.
You may need to refresh the page.

Well yeah, it's social media.
I figure it's on the user to curate their own experience.
I mean, no one should watch a TV channel they don't like and moan about it.
